canonical.name: Hong
canonical.title: 32. Hong / The Long Enduring
canonical.judgment: Hong indicates successful progress and no error in what it denotes. But the advantage will come from being firm and correct; and movement in any direction whatever will be advantageous.
canonical.image: The trigram representing thunder and that for wind form Hong. The superior person, in accordance with this, stands firm, and does not change their method of operation.

1.text: shows its subject deeply desirous of long continuance. Even with firm correctness there will be evil; there will be no advantage in any way.

2.text: shows all occasion for repentance disappearing.

3.text: shows one who does not continuously maintain their virtue. There are those who will impute this to them as a disgrace. However firm they may be, there will be grounds for regret

4.text: shows a field where there is no game.

5.text: shows its subject continuously maintaining the virtue indicated by it. In a wife this will be fortunate; in a husband, evil.

6.text: shows its subject exciting themself to long continuance. There will be evil.

metadata.notes: Original translation preserved from pyChing v1.2.2
